description: Crêpes. Savory with ham and cheese, sweet with apple and cinnamon. Crêpes are made one at a time, each in their own pan.

directions.step: In a mixing bowl whisk the flour, milk, and egg together until completely even and smooth.
Add a little flour or milk until the batter moves like a liquid but looks and feels viscous.
Optional but recommended: Let sit covered with cling film in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes (this is in addition to the prep time).
Heat a non-stick frying pan on medium heat and coat the bottom with a small melted pat of butter.
Pour about 1/2 cup of batter in the pan, spread the batter out on the bottom of the pan in a nice thin flat layer.

When the batter turns translucent take a spatula and check the bottom surface of the Crêpe. When it has colored flip the Crêpe to cook the other side (either with a spatula or with an nice flick of the wrist with the pan).
Add 1/2 cup of shredded cheese to the center of the Crêpe. Lay 1 ounce of ham on the cheese. Season to taste.
When the other side of the Crêpe has colored, fold the Crêpe in thirds and serve.
Slice half the apple into thin slices and lay them all on the middle of the Crêpe.
Sprinkle the Crêpe liberally with 2 tablespoons of sugar and 2 teaspoons of cinnamon.
When the bottom of the Crêpe has colored, fold into quarters by first folding in half and then folding once more in the other direction.
Serve with syrup and powdered sugar sprinkled on top.

(Other fillings are possible and also very good. For example, nutella for a very rich sweet Crêpe. Kiwi and brown sugar makes for a nice light healthy dessert. For a very fancy one try pre-soaking some fruit like peach and raisins in something like cognac and serve by flambeing with some more cognac right on a plate, don't worry when you flambe the alcohol burns off but leaves the flavor of the specific alcohol.)
